Create a new protocol as part of your research project or manuscript. Multiple protocols can be created per manuscript within a research project workspace.

methodology_summary.description: List the main statistical or algorithmic approaches used to answer the research question or objective

protocol_type.description:
OBSERVATIONAL STUDY 
Descriptive Research: The researcher asks a question or set of questions from the data and no specific hypothesis is defined. The output should be limited to summary statistics, without an analysis plan or comparisons. Analytic Research (cohort, case-control and cross-sectional studies): Research that aims to answer a specific hypothesis based on observation of the patient data. 
METHODS
Methodological Development (Shared Resource/Tool/Dataset): The researcher aims to create a resource that can be used to answer further research questions e.g. the output is a dataset tool or lookup that supports the conduct of future research
EXPERIMENTAL STUDY
Control trials i.e. assigned intervention

protocol_status_notes.description: Add a reason for the status, if useful, e.g. awaiting analyst resources, awaiting data improvements

pasc_or_n3c.description: If your work receives funding to investigate PASC e.g. through RECOVER, please select ‘Yes’

manuscript_text_document_link.description: Please provide either a link to your manuscript/presentation/abstract in a shared Google drive (give read access to n3c.pubs@gmail.com) or indicate that you are emailing a PDF/Word/pptx version to n3c.pubs@gmail.com. Your document cannot be reviewed until a draft is made available. PLEASE INCLUDE AUTHOR LIST IN YOUR DRAFT

n3c_consortium_vs_project_based_work.description: N3C Consortium manuscripts are about the creation of the N3C (e.g. N3C vision, methodology, data description, quality assurance, community development, infrastructure, harmonization, governance, administration). Project-based manuscripts are about discoveries that were enabled by the N3C and are associated with one or more approved Data Use Request (DURs)

contributor_role_subclass.description: Contributor role subclasses are derived from the OWL ontology. For role subclass descriptions please see https://www.ebi.ac.uk/ols/ontologies/cro

code-snippet.description: Add a snippet of code you wish to showcase in this note. Spacing and line breaks will be retained and rendered in the final code display.

body.description: Markdown can be used when creating this note and will be rendered in the final note display.

include_descendants.description: If true, then these expression items will match on the selected OMOP Concepts, and all of their descendants.

is_excluded.description: If true, then any concepts matched will be added to the expression as exclusion rather than inclusion criteria. Exclusion criteria take precedence over inclusion criteria, in cases when a single OMOP Concept is affected by more than one entry in the OMOP Concept Set Expression.

include_mapped.description: If true, then these expression items will match on the selected OMOP Concepts, and all of the Non-Standard OMOP Concepts that map to them. If Include Descendants is also true, then this option will also include all OMOP Concepts that map to the included descendants. Setting this to true enables you to include non-standard Concepts in your Concept Set. Mapping is the process to transform one Concept into a Standard one. Read more: ohdsi.github.io/TheBookOfOhdsi/Cohorts.html#conceptSets and https://www.ohdsi.org/web/wiki/doku.php?id=documentation:vocabulary:mapping

n3cknowledgeObjects.description: Add Knowledge Objects for this Publication Intent

data.description: Link the DUR to a Research Project that has been created for it

research-project.description: The new Research Project that you have already created for this DUR, using the Create Project Form

data.description: Deletes the selected Concept Set Expression items and removes them from the associated Concept Set Version draft.

data_tier.description:
If the resource you are requesting to add to this Knowledge Object is a Dataset or a Code Workbook, please specify its Data Tier (e.g. LDS, De-identified or Synthetic).

If it's a Code Workbook Template, and if the Code Workbook Template has input datasets that are 'pinned' (i.e. default Datasets that are to be automatically imported), please specify the Data Tier of the input Datasets (e.g. LDS, De-identified or Synthetic). If the Template does not have any pinned dataset inputs, please select 'Valid for all data tiers'. 

If the resource you are requesting to add is a Documentation (i.e. Report or Notepad) or a Custom Python Library code repository, please select 'Valid for all data tiers'.

resource_id.description:
Please paste the URL of the resource you would like to submit. 

You can also paste the 'resource id': A 'Resource' is the artifact you are trying to share (e.g. Dataset, Report, Code Workbook, Code Workbook Template, Code Repository). The 'rid' (aka resource identifier) uniquely identifies the resource in the platform. You will find it in the URL (starts with 'ri.' , e.g. ri.report.main.report.332c8134-b112-4253-9aed-8779b5a39421, or ri.foundry.main.dataset.5cb3c4a3-327a-47bf-a8bf-daf0cafe6772)

data.description: Submit required attestations and IRB Determination letter.

irb-determination-letter.description: If not sure please consult your HRPP

human-subjects-training-attestation.description: NCATS does not specify which human subjects training course should be taken to allow flexibility for the resources individual organizations will have adopted for use in their local research programs. Please follow your home institutions requirements to meet this expectation.  Training must be completed within three years of the Data Use Request submission.

copyExpressionsFromBaseVersion.description: If true, Expressions (OMOP concept inclusion and exclusion rules) are copied from the Base Concept Set Version to this draft concept set. If false, this draft concept set is initialized as an empty concept set.
